chunks.text: Semicolons
Semicolons are the ones that look like ; (just to be sure).
Semicolons, quite simply, go between phrases that could stand alone as their own sentences (“independent clauses).
Stylistically, they indicate a closer connection between two clauses than a period does.
However, since the two are so similar grammatically, we can always test whether or not a semicolon is in the right place by switching it with a period.
If a period works somewhere (adjusting the capitalization accordingly), then a semicolon would work in the same place.
It started raining; I started moping.
After all of that studying, I knew I’d do well on the test; therefore, I was unsurprised when I found out I’d aced it.
It started raining; I started moping.
We have full independent clauses on both sides of the semicolon.
Both It started raining and I started moping could stand on their own as sentences.
We use a semicolon in between them to indicate the relationship between the clauses (I started moping because it was raining).
It started raining. I started moping.
Since a period works here, a semicolon would work too.
After all of that studying, I knew I’d do well on the test; therefore, I was unsurprised when I found out I’d aced it.
We added a little bit to this example, but it works for the same reason the previous one worked.
Both After all of that studying, I knew I’d do well on the test and therefore, I was unsurprised when I found out I’d aced it include perfectly functional independent clauses.
After all of that studying, I knew I’d do well on the test. Therefore, I was unsurprised when I found out I’d aced it.
Since we can replace the semicolon with a period, we know we can use a semicolon here.
Comma or semicolon?
Comma or semicolon?

chunks.text: Review
Semicolons connect independent clauses.
Both sides of a semicolon should be to work as their own sentences.
Thus, we can test semicolon use with periods.
If a period works somewhere, a semicolon could work too.
He studied French; she studied Spanish.
She’d visited Spain, France, China, Malaysia, Australia, Belize, Argentina, and Mexico; he’d never left the country.
